intro: Agyneia obliqua, commonly known as the narrowleaf agyneia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Agyneia obliqua is often found in grassland habitats and is adapted to dry conditions.
